hypothesis: North Korea is separated from South Korea by the Korean Demilitarized Zone and it is a dictatorship.
premise: + North Korea + To the north and northwest the country is bordered by China and by Russia along the Amnok ( known as the Yalu in China ) and Tumen rivers ; it is bordered to the south by South Korea , with the heavily fortified Korean Demilitarized Zone ( DMZ ) separating the two . + Korean Demilitarized Zone + It is established by the provisions of the Korean Armistice Agreement to serve as a buffer zone between the Democratic People 's Republic of Korea ( North Korea ) and the Republic of Korea ( South Korea ) . + Korean Demilitarized Zone + The Korean Demilitarized Zone ( DMZ ; ) is a strip of land running across the Korean Peninsula . + Korean Demilitarized Zone + The Demilitarized zone ( DMZ ) is a border barrier that divides the Korean Peninsula roughly in half . + South Korea + South Korea , officially the Republic of Korea ( ROK ; ) , is a sovereign state in East Asia , constituting the southern part of the Korean Peninsula .
explanation_1: North Korea is separated from South Korea by the Korean Demilitarized Zone. It is a dictatorship.

hypothesis: Jacki Weaver worked in Australia.
premise: + Jacki Weaver + Jacqueline Ruth `` Jacki '' Weaver , AO ( born 25 May 1947 ) is an Australian theatre , film , and television actress . + Jacki Weaver + Weaver emerged in the 1970s as a symbol of the Australian New Wave through her work in Ozploitation films such as Stork ( 1971 ) , Alvin Purple ( 1973 ) and Petersen ( 1974 ) . + Ozploitation + Ozploitation ( a portmanteau of Australia and exploitation ) films are exploitation films - a category of low-budget horror , comedy , and action films - made in Australia after the introduction of the R rating in 1971 . + Australian New Wave + The Australian New Wave ( also known as the Australian Film Revival , Australian Film Renaissance , or New Australian Cinema ) was an era of resurgence in worldwide popularity of Australian cinema , particularly in the United States . + Alvin Purple + Alvin Purple is an 1973 Australian comedy film starring Graeme Blundell , written by Alan Hopgood and directed by Tim Burstall .
explanation_1: Jacki Weaver was born in Australia and has worked in Australia.

premise: + The Heiress (1947 play) + The Heiress is a 1947 play by American playwrights Ruth and Augustus Goetz adapted from the 1880 Henry James novel Washington Square . + Ruth Goetz + Ruth Goetz ( January 12 , 1912 - October 12 , 2001 ) was an American playwright , screenwriter , and translator along with her husband and collaborator Augustus Goetz . + Henry James + Henry James , OM was an American-born British writer .

hypothesis: Harley Quinn appeared in novels.

hypothesis: Bela Lugosi did not act in horror films.

Ulmer and starring Béla Lugosi and Boris Karloff .

hypothesis: Sense8 is a film.

Michael Straczynski for Netflix . + Toby Onwumere + Toby Onwumere is an actor known for the role of Capheus on the second season of the Netflix television series Sense8 . + Location shooting + Location shooting is the shooting of a film or television production in a real-world setting rather than a sound stage or backlot . + Streaming media + Streaming media is multimedia that is constantly received by and presented to an end-user while being delivered by a provider . + Sense8 + The show 's first season introduced a multinational ensemble cast , with Aml Ameen , Doona Bae , Jamie Clayton , Tina Desai , Tuppence Middleton , Max Riemelt , Miguel Ángel Silvestre and Brian J. Smith portraying eight strangers from different parts of the world who suddenly become `` sensates '' ; human beings who are mentally and emotionally linked .

hypothesis: Marble Hill is in Cambridge.

hypothesis: Doctor Who is from America.

hypothesis: Cricket is an individual sport.
premise: + Cricket + Cricket is a bat-and-ball game played between two teams of eleven players on a cricket field , at the centre of which is a rectangular 22-yard-long pitch with a wicket ( a set of three wooden stumps ) at each end . + Cricket + One team bats , attempting to score as many runs as possible , whilst their opponents field . + Test cricket + Test cricket is the longest form of the sport of cricket and is considered its highest standard . + Cricket + ICC , the game 's governing body , has over 100 members , ten of which are full members who play Test cricket . + Test cricket + Test matches are played between national representative teams with `` Test status '' , as determined by the International Cricket Council ( ICC ) .
